tool.name: IsobaricAnalyzer
tool.description: Calculates isobaric quantitative values for peptides
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("consensusxml")}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("consensusxml")}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: type
param.label: Isobaric Quantitation method used in the experiment

param.name: in
param.label: input raw/picked data file

param.name: select_activation
param.label: Operate only on MSn scans where any of its precursors features a certain activation method
param.help: (e.g., usually HCD for iTRAQ). Set to empty string if you want to disable filtering

param.name: reporter_mass_shift
param.label: Allowed shift (left to right) in Th from the expected position

param.name: min_precursor_intensity
param.label: Minimum intensity of the precursor to be extracted
param.help: MS/MS scans having a precursor with a lower intensity will not be considered for quantitation

param.name: keep_unannotated_precursor
param.label: Flag if precursor with missing intensity value or missing precursor spectrum should be included or not

param.name: min_reporter_intensity
param.label: Minimum intensity of the individual reporter ions to be extracted

param.name: discard_low_intensity_quantifications
param.label: Remove all reporter intensities if a single reporter is below the threshold given in 'min_reporter_intensity'

param.name: min_precursor_purity
param.label: Minimum fraction of the total intensity in the isolation window of the precursor spectrum attributable to the selected precurso

param.name: precursor_isotope_deviation
param.label: Maximum allowed deviation (in ppm) between theoretical and observed isotopic peaks of the precursor peak in the isolation window to be counted as part of the precurso

param.name: purity_interpolation
param.label: If set to true the algorithm will try to compute the purity as a time weighted linear combination of the precursor scan and the following scan
param.help: If set to false, only the precursor scan will be used

param.name: channel_114_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 114 channel

param.name: channel_115_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 115 channel

param.name: channel_116_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 116 channel

param.name: channel_117_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 117 channel

param.name: reference_channel
param.label: Number of the reference channel (114-117)

param.name: correction_matrix
param.label: Correction matrix for isotope distributions (see documentation); use the following format: <-2Da>/<-1Da>/<+1Da>/<+2Da>;
param.help: e.g. '0/0.3/4/0', '0.1/0.3/3/0.2' (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: channel_113_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 113 channel

param.name: channel_114_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 114 channel

param.name: channel_115_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 115 channel

param.name: channel_116_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 116 channel

param.name: channel_117_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 117 channel

param.name: channel_118_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 118 channel

param.name: channel_119_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 119 channel

param.name: channel_121_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 121 channel

param.name: reference_channel
param.label: Number of the reference channel (113-121)
param.help: Please note that 120 is not valid

param.name: correction_matrix
param.label: Correction matrix for isotope distributions (see documentation); use the following format: <-2Da>/<-1Da>/<+1Da>/<+2Da>;
param.help: e.g. '0/0.3/4/0', '0.1/0.3/3/0.2' (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: isotope_correction
param.label: Enable isotope correction (highly recommended)
param.help: Note that you need to provide a correct isotope correction matrix otherwise the tool will fail or produce invalid results

param.name: normalization
param.label: Enable normalization of channel intensities with respect to the reference channel
param.help: The normalization is done by using the Median of Ratios (every channel / Reference). Also the ratio of medians (from any channel and reference) is provided as control measure!

param.name: channel_126_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 126 channel

param.name: channel_127N_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 127N channel

param.name: channel_127C_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 127C channel

param.name: channel_128N_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 128N channel

param.name: channel_128C_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 128C channel

param.name: channel_129N_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 129N channel

param.name: channel_129C_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 129C channel

param.name: channel_130N_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 130N channel

param.name: channel_130C_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 130C channel

param.name: channel_131_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 131 channel

param.name: correction_matrix
param.label: Correction matrix for isotope distributions (see documentation); use the following format: <-2Da>/<-1Da>/<+1Da>/<+2Da>;
param.help: e.g. '0/0.3/4/0', '0.1/0.3/3/0.2' (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: channel_126_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 126 channel

param.name: channel_127N_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 127N channel

param.label: Description for the content of the 127C channel

param.help: e.g. '0/0.3/4/0', '0.1/0.3/3/0.2' (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.label: Description for the content of the 126 channel

param.label: Description for the content of the 127N channel

param.label: Description for the content of the 127C channel

param.label: Description for the content of the 128N channel

param.label: Description for the content of the 128C channel

param.label: Description for the content of the 129N channel

param.label: Description for the content of the 129C channel

param.label: Description for the content of the 130N channel

param.label: Description for the content of the 130C channel

param.label: Description for the content of the 134N channel

param.help: e.g. '0/0.3/4/0', '0.1/0.3/3/0.2' (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: channel_126_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 126 channel

param.label: Description for the content of the 127 channel

param.name: channel_128_description
param.label: Description for the content of the 128 channel

param.label: Number of the reference channel (126-131)

param.name: correction_matrix
param.label: Correction matrix for isotope distributions (see documentation); use the following format: <-2Da>/<-1Da>/<+1Da>/<+2Da>;
param.help: e.g. '0/0.3/4/0', '0.1/0.3/3/0.2' (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: force
param.label: Overrides tool-specific checks

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Calculates isobaric quantitative values for peptides
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/release/2.6.0/html/TOPP_IsobaricAnalyzer.html
